How many square feet is Brittany's comforter?

The comforter had 3347396 red squares, 4 more blue squares than red squares, 6 more green squares than blue squares, and 12 fewer white squares than green squares. direct_answer.text:
Let's break down this problem into parts based on the hints provided:
Red squares = x = 3347396 (red)
Blue squares = x + 4 = 3347396 + 4 = 3347400 (blue)
Green squares = (blue_squares + 6) = 3347400 + 6 = 3347406 (green)
White squares = (green_squares - 12) = 3347406 - 12 = 3347394 (white)
To find out the size of the entire comforter, we sum up all colors since every color occupies exactly one square foot area per unit – so just add them together because you said it was made using these individual units/squares only! Therefore: Total Squares(Total Feet^2)= Red + Blue + Green + White

subanswer.text: To convert weights from kilograms to pounds, use the factor whereby 1 kilogram equals approximately 2.20462 pounds. Applying this factor allows us to transform values expressed in kilograms into their corresponding figures displayed in pounds via multiplication operation — essentially multiplying input value(in kg) x 2.20462 yields output result representative of analogous entity quantified by alternative denomination mark denoted lb i.e.: Example case study showcases calculation procedure employed below illustrates such transformation process demonstratively substantiating methodology accuracy verifiability essential preemptively averting erroneous computations likely inducing substantial repercussions particularly cases entail significant monetary valuations concerns precise dosages medicinal prescriptions necessitating meticulous attention

direct_answer.text: To convert a mass from kilograms to pounds, multiply the amount in kilograms by the conversion factor 2.20462. Here's the general formula: \[ \text{pounds} = \text{kilograms} \times 2.20462 \]
